definitions.title: adv.
definitions.body: (from [[אַי]]; As. aina, ainu, Arab. 0’ayna where ? min 0’ayna whence ?) only in the compound [[מֵאַ֫יִן]]:17

definitions.title: whence ?
definitions.body: Ge 29:4, Ge 42:7 (syn. [[אֵי־מִזֶּה]] e.g. Ge 16:8, 1Sa 30:13) Ju Jdg 17:9, Jdg 19:17, Job 1:7 (Job 2:2 [[אֵי־מִזֶּה]]); used in a rhet. or poet. style (where [[אֵי־מִזֶּה]] would be too prosaic) Nu 11:13 [[מֵאַיִן לִי בָּשָׂר]] whence have I flesh etc. ? 2Ki 6:27, Je 30:7 Alas! for that day is great; [[מֵאַיִן כָּמוֹהוּ]] whence is its like ? (see also II. [[אַיִן]] ad fin.) Na 3:7, Ps 121:1, Job 28:12, Job 28:20; in an indirect sentence Jos 2:4 (cf. [[אֵי־מִזֶּה]] 1Sa 25:11).
